turns.content:
Help me to write a full Lab Report with an introduction, objective, procedure, discussion and conclusion for the below lab test using Cisco Packet Tracer:

Lab 2: Explore subnet creation for a network and network extension
Task 1: You are given three blocks of IP address 200.128.1.0/24, 200.128.2.0/24 and 200.128.3.0/24. Using the given address blocks create three separate networks each having two subnets with equal number of addresses. Connect two nodes in each subnet and configure the arrangement so that any node is able to communicate with the remaining nodes (within the subnet as well as in other subnets). Identify and analyze the configuration requirements. Verify the communication setup and reach ability with Ping diagnostic command. Your report should include the following:
i. Network diagram for Task 1
ii. List and explain what devices are used for the setup of the network and any other configuration required
iii. Confirm the configuration is achieved according to the plan
iv. and finally Verify that each computers can communicate with the remaining computers in the subnets of the network

Lab Report: Explore Subnet Creation for a Network and Network Extension

Introduction:

In this lab, we were given three blocks of IP addresses: 200.128.1.0/24, 200.128.2.0/24 and 200.128.3.0/24. The objective was to create three separate networks each having two subnets with an equal number of addresses, and to connect two nodes in each subnet. The goal was to configure the arrangement so that any node is able to communicate with the remaining nodes within the subnet, as well as in other subnets. The plan was to use the Ping diagnostic command to verify the communication setup and reachability.

Objective:

The objective of this lab was to explore the process of creating subnets for a network and extending the network using the given blocks of IP addresses. We also aimed to understand the configuration requirements and verify the communication setup and reachability using the Ping diagnostic command.

Procedure:

1. First, we used the Cisco Packet Tracer software to set up three separate networks, each with two subnets.
2. In each subnet, we connected two nodes (computers or devices).
3. We configured the arrangement so that any node was able to communicate with the remaining nodes within the subnet, as well as in other subnets.
4. We identified and analyzed the configuration requirements for the setup.
5. Finally, we used the Ping diagnostic command to verify the communication setup and reachability.

Discussion:

To set up the three separate networks and subnets, we used a combination of routers and switches. The routers were used to connect the different networks, while the switches were used to create the subnets within each network. We also had to configure the IP addresses and subnet masks for each device, as well as set up the default gateway for the nodes.

We were able to confirm that the configuration was achieved according to the plan, as all of the nodes were able to communicate with each other within the subnets and across the different networks. The Ping diagnostic command was used to verify the communication setup and reachability, and we were able to successfully ping all of the nodes from each other.

Conclusion:

In this lab, we explored the process of creating subnets for a network and extending the network using the given blocks of IP addresses. We were able to successfully set up the three separate networks and subnets, and configure the arrangement so that any node was able to communicate with the remaining nodes within the subnet, as well as in other subnets. We also verified the communication setup and reachability using the Ping diagnostic command. This lab helped us understand the configuration requirements for setting up a network and extending it, as well as the importance of verifying the communication setup and reachability.
Rewrite it in the most academic way possible

Lab Report: Exploration of Subnet Creation and Network Extension

Introduction:

Networking is a crucial aspect of modern communication systems. One important aspect of networking is subnetting, which involves dividing a network into smaller subnetworks or subnets. This process allows for better organization and utilization of the available IP addresses within the network. In this lab, we were tasked with exploring the process of creating subnets for a network and extending the network using the given blocks of IP addresses: 200.128.1.0/24, 200.128.2.0/24 and 200.128.3.0/24. The objective of this lab was to understand the configuration requirements and verify the communication setup and reachability using the Ping diagnostic command.

Objective:

The objective of this lab was to understand the process of creating subnets for a network and extending the network using the given blocks of IP addresses. We also aimed to identify and analyze the configuration requirements for the setup, and verify the communication setup and reachability using the Ping diagnostic command.

Procedure:

1. Using the Cisco Packet Tracer software, we set up three separate networks, each with two subnets.
2. In each subnet, we connected two nodes (computers or devices).
3. We configured the arrangement so that any node was able to communicate with the remaining nodes within the subnet, as well as in other subnets.
4. We identified and analyzed the configuration requirements for the setup.
5. Finally, we used the Ping diagnostic command to verify the communication setup and reachability.

Discussion:

To set up the three separate networks and subnets, we utilized a combination of routers and switches. The routers were used to connect the different networks, while the switches were used to create the subnets within each network. It was necessary to configure the IP addresses and subnet masks for each device, as well as set up the default gateway for the nodes.

Through this process, we were able to confirm that the configuration was achieved according to the plan. All of the nodes were able to communicate with each other within the subnets and across the different networks. The Ping diagnostic command was used to verify the communication setup and reachability, and we were able to successfully ping all of the nodes from each other.

Conclusion:

This lab provided us with an understanding of the process of creating subnets for a network and extending the network using the given blocks of IP addresses. We were able to successfully set up the three separate networks and subnets, and configure the arrangement so that any node was able to communicate with the remaining nodes within the subnet, as well as in other subnets. We also verified the communication setup and reachability using the Ping diagnostic command. This lab helped us gain a deeper appreciation for the configuration requirements of setting up a network and extending it, as well as the importance of verifying the communication setup and reachability.

Task 2: Extend the networks you have created in Task 1 by connecting them and configuring the arrangement so that any node belonging to any network is able to communicate with any other nodes belonging other networks. Identify and analyze the configuration requirements. Verify the communication setup and reach ability with Ping diagnostic command.

Rewrite the report based on the Task 2 given

Lab Report: Extension of Network Created in Task 1

Introduction:

In the previous task, we explored the process of creating subnets for a network and extending the network using the given blocks of IP addresses: 200.128.1.0/24, 200.128.2.0/24 and 200.128.3.0/24. In this task, we were tasked with extending the networks created in Task 1 by connecting them and configuring the arrangement so that any node belonging to any network was able to communicate with any other nodes belonging to other networks. The objective of this lab was to understand the configuration requirements and verify the communication setup and reachability using the Ping diagnostic command.

Objective:

The objective of this lab was to extend the networks created in Task 1 by connecting them and configuring the arrangement so that any node belonging to any network was able to communicate with any other nodes belonging to other networks. We also aimed to identify and analyze the configuration requirements for the setup, and verify the communication setup and reachability using the Ping diagnostic command.

Procedure:

1. We started by connecting the three networks created in Task 1 using routers.
2. We configured the arrangement so that any node belonging to any network was able to communicate with any other nodes belonging to other networks.
3. We identified and analyzed the configuration requirements for the setup.
4. Finally, we used the Ping diagnostic command to verify the communication setup and reachability.

Discussion:

To extend the networks created in Task 1, we used routers to connect the different networks. We also had to configure the IP addresses and subnet masks for the routers, as well as set up the default gateway for the nodes. This process allowed us to create a larger network that encompassed all three of the networks created in Task 1.

Through this process, we were able to confirm that the configuration was achieved according to the plan. All of the nodes were able to communicate with each other within the subnets and across the different networks. The Ping diagnostic command was used to verify the communication setup and reachability, and we were able to successfully ping all of the nodes from each other.

Conclusion:

This lab helped us understand the process of extending the networks created in Task 1 by connecting them and configuring the arrangement so that any node belonging to any network was able to communicate with any other nodes belonging to other networks. We were able to successfully set up the extended network and verify the communication setup and reachability using the Ping diagnostic command. This lab also allowed us to gain a deeper appreciation for the configuration requirements of setting up and extending a network, as well as the importance of verifying the communication setup and reachability.
